references.paper_title: Self-supervised augmentation consistency for adapting semantic segmentation
references.reason: This paper introduces a self-supervised augmentation consistency framework for unsupervised domain adaptation, which is highly relevant to the cross-view adaptation task tackled in the main paper.

references.paper_title: Deeplab: Semantic image segmentation with deep convolutional nets, atrous convolution, and fully connected CRFs
references.reason: This paper introduces the DeepLab semantic segmentation model, which serves as the foundation for the open-vocabulary semantic segmentation models used in the main paper's experiments.

references.paper_title: DAFormer: Improving network architectures and training strategies for domain-adaptive semantic segmentation
references.reason: This paper proposes the DAFormer model, which significantly improves the performance of unsupervised domain adaptation in semantic segmentation and is a key competitor to the proposed EAGLE model.

references.paper_title: Freeseg: Unified, universal and open-vocabulary image segmentation
references.reason: This paper introduces the FreeSeg model, a unified and universal open-vocabulary image segmentation framework, which the main paper adopts and adapts to its cross-view adaptation setting.

references.paper_title: Learning transferable visual models from natural language supervision
references.reason: This paper introduces the CLIP model, a large vision-language model which is essential to the open-vocabulary semantic segmentation approach that the main paper builds upon.
